New Records: Rachin Ravindra became the first player to hit three centuries in their debut World Cup!
New Zealand scored 401, their highest score at a World Cup, against Pakistan.
Key Match Events: Fakhar Zaman scored an unbeaten 126 off 81 balls
Shafique was caught by Williamson for 4 (Pakistan 6-1)
Rachin Ravindra scored 108*, his third century of the tournament
Pakistan needed 402 to stay in the World Cup!
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan win the toss and bowl
Pandya ruled out of World Cup
The race for the top four is HOTTING UP...
Post-Match Reflections: Babar Azam expressed confidence in their team's ability to continue playing positively
Kane Williamson acknowledged Pakistan's exceptional performance and their target of 402
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side
England can still qualify for the semi-finals if New Zealand beats Pakistan in the early game
Others: The pitch is much better than expected, certainly when the quicks are bowling, but it's hard to see how Pakistan can pull this off
